answerText: Kalmykia[10] This longest river in Europe flows through an eastern portion of Kalmykia. This river empties into the Caspian Sea near the city of Astrakhan.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Dartmouth A Round 13 | 5 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: This region is the only majority-Buddhist region in Europe. For 10 points each: [10] Name this region in Russia with capital Elista. It is named for a group of Oirat descendants who migrated there around the seventeenth century, many of whom returned to Dzungaria under the leadership of Ubashi Khan.
